title: Brigitte Bardot's funeral: Far-right leader Le Pen will attend, Macron will not
subhead: The film star's animal foundation said her funeral in a church in her southern hometown of Saint-Tropez on January 7 would be followed by a private burial, but has not said where.

title: UK moves to ban boiling lobsters, shrimp, crabs and langoustines alive, recognizing their capacity for pain
subhead: The measure, to be implemented by 2030, would also apply to crustaceans and cephalopod mollusks, including octopuses, all of which are recognized as sentient beings under British law.

title: 'In the beginning, I was very diligent, more than other believers from Muslim backgrounds': Grégory's conversion to Islam
subhead: 'Changing Faith' (3/11). Why do people choose a particular religion? Attracted from a young age to Islam, Grégory Gonty, a 35-year-old Belgian social worker, became Muslim at the age of 21. The fervent believer has since become a knowledgeable and inquisitive practitioner.

title: Europe's dramatic decline in pharmaceutical production threatens health sovereignty
